facts: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't. Botanically speaking, bananas qualify as berries, while strawberries do not because their seeds are on the outside.
Honey never spoils. Archaeologists have found pots of honey in ancient Egyptian tombs that are over 3,000 years old and still perfectly edible.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus. Venus takes 243 Earth days to rotate once on its axis but only 225 Earth days to orbit the Sun.
Sharks existed before trees. Sharks have been around for over 400 million years, while the first trees appeared around 350 million years ago.
The Eiffel Tower can grow taller in summer. Due to thermal expansion, the metal of the Eiffel Tower expands in the heat, making it grow by about 6 inches (15 cm).
Polar bears are nearly undetectable by infrared cameras. Their thick fur and blubber make them almost invisible in thermal imaging.
The heart of a blue whale is the size of a small car. It weighs around 400 pounds (180 kg) and pumps nearly 60 gallons of blood with each beat.
Sloths can hold their breath longer than dolphins. Sloths can slow their heart rate and hold their breath for up to 40 minutes, while dolphins typically hold theirs for about 10 minutes.
The inventor of the Pringles can is buried in one. Fred Baur, who designed the iconic Pringles container, had his ashes buried in one after his death.
The first oranges werenâ€™t orange. The original oranges from Southeast Asia were green, and even today, some warm-weather oranges stay green when ripe.
